title: n-api and n-cpu receive timeouts from q-svc because of 'Lock Wait timeout'

comments.content: Added Nova, Neutron and the Neutron Client (used by Nova's Neutron driver) as the interaction is subtle and more eyes might help point out what I'm missing.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fungi

comments.content:
310 matches in the past week for message:"Connection to neutron failed: HTTPConnectionPool(host='127.0.0.1', port=9696): Read timed out" AND filename:"logs/screen-n-api.txt" (100% FAILURE build_status).

http://logstash.openstack.org/#
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fungi

comments.content:
Yeh, it looks like neutron is timing out the connection (possibly some other locking?), the request is eventually handled later, but it's too late.

http://logs.openstack.org/12/123112/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/cdb7110/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_2014-09-22_14_16_48_510
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: Indeed there is a gap of 48 seconds after the last "Got semaphore "db-access" lock"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~enikanorov

comments.content:
> Indeed there is a gap of 48 seconds after the last "Got semaphore "db-access" lock"

It is sure that execution of update_device_down takes 48 sec by  looking q-agt log in addition to q-svc log.
It seems there is no concurrent operation executed in neutron-server.
So I guess that there is an external factor to block neutron-server process.
And I found the following:
http://logs.openstack.org/12/123112/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/cdb7110/logs/syslog.txt.gz#_Sep_22_14_16_00

Iscsi device was failed just same period (16:00-16:48).
I think this is cause of this problem. 
(eg. writing to DB was blocked at that period)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~oda-g

comments.content: @dql why did you change this to a New state? What makes you think the incomplete nature of the nova bug was resolved?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: I believe this is a neutron timeout issue, marking as Invalid
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: Moving to Liberty-1 now in the hopes of raising the visibility of this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mestery

comments.content:
Changed bug title to reflect what it is in reality.
Between n-api and n-cpu there are now only 32 hits in a week, 80% failure rate.

It is nowhere near the 310 hits per week noticed back in september so I'm decreasing the priority to medium
